alert.note: Alert for Brooks; Inland Cameron; Inland Kenedy; Inland Willacy; Jim Hogg; Northern Hidalgo; Southern Hidalgo; Starr; Zapata (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 18 at 12:47PM CDT until March 18 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...Threat of rapid wildfire growth and spread... .The combination of gusty breezy north winds, very low relative humidity values, and dry grasses and brush, will allow for any wildfire activity to grow and spread rapidly through this afternoon. Residents should be very vigilant with items that could create sparks and ignite the dry grasses and brush. ...RED FLAG WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR DRY FUELS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY VALUES, AND ENHANCED POST FRONTAL WINDS FOR PORTIONS OF DEEP SOUTH TEXAS... * TIMING...From 10 AM CDT until 4 PM CDT. * WIND...North 15 to 20 mph. * HUMIDITY...15 to 20 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means critical fire weather conditions are occurring now...or will shortly. In general...these conditions include sustained 20 foot winds of 25 MPH or greater...humidity ranging from below 25 percent in Zapata County to below 45 percent along the coast...each lasting for 2 hours or longer... and cured fuels. Humidity below 25 percent in most areas will trigger fire danger at lower wind speeds. Detailed decision tables are found at HTTP://WEATHER.GOV/RGV/?N=MAPCOLORS#FIRE.
